channel.title: Gas gangrene on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections
channel.description: Recent content in Gas gangrene on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections

item.description: The abovementioned C. welchii, which today is already called C. perfringens is a bacterium of the same family as tetanus. It is also anaerobic, lives in soil, in human and animal intestines, in dust, and is as common as C. tetani. However, since there is no vaccine against this bacterium, you probably have not heard anything about it. This is a bit strange, since it causes a far more dangerous and more common disease – gas gangrene.
